\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Introduction}}\label{Chapter_Introduction}
\logpage{[ 1, 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7DFB63A97E67C0A1}{}
{
  

 A local action diagram $\Delta = (\Gamma, (G(v)), (X_a))$ consists of: 
\begin{itemize}
\item  a directed graph $\Gamma$, 
\item  a closed permutation group $G(v)$ for each $v \in V(\Gamma)$, and 
\item  a set $X_{a}$ for each $a \in A(\Gamma)$ such that each $X_{a}$ is disjoint and $X_{a}$ is an orbit of the action of $G(o(a))$ on $X_{v} := \bigsqcup_{a \in o^{-1}(v)}X_{a}$. 
\end{itemize}
 

 The definition of digraph used is different to that of the \textsf{Digraphs} package. For our purposes, a digraph $\Gamma$ consists of: 
\begin{itemize}
\item  a vertex set $V$, 
\item  an arc set $A$, 
\item  a map $o : A \to V$ assigning each arc to an \emph{origin} vertex, and 
\item  a bijection $r : A \to A$ (denoted by $a \mapsto \overline{a}$) such that $r^{2} = \mathrm{id}$. 
\end{itemize}
 The bijection $r$ defines a reverse arc for each arc of the graph. This is more specific than
the definition in the \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape digraphs}} package which does not require a reverse mapping. 

 The local action diagrams package provides a category for local action
diagrams. It is built in the \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape IsDigraph}} category from the \textsf{Digraphs} package. 

 }

   
\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Creating Local Action Diagrams}}\label{Chapter_Creating_Local_Action_Diagrams}
\logpage{[ 2, 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X84CBE9FE85CF5E9D}{}
{
  
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Creating Local Action Diagrams}}\label{Chapter_Creating_Local_Action_Diagrams_Section_Creating_Local_Action_Diagrams}
\logpage{[ 2, 1, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X84CBE9FE85CF5E9D}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{IsLocalActionDiagram (for IsDigraph)}}
\logpage{[ 2, 1, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X78FCE92F7B97951A}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{IsLocalActionDiagram({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{IsLocalActionDiagram@\texttt{IsLocalActionDiagram}!for IsDigraph}
\label{IsLocalActionDiagram:for IsDigraph}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (filter)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
\texttt{true} if \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} is of the category \texttt{IsLocalActionDiagram} and \texttt{false} otherwise. 



 Every local action diagram belongs to the \texttt{IsLocalActionDiagram} category. Every local action diagram is immutable. }

 
\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Constructing From Data}}\label{Creating_Local_Action_Diagrams}
\logpage{[ 2, 1, 2 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X83D230F77F47F86F}{}
{
\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramFromData({\mdseries\slshape D, vertex{\textunderscore}labels, edge{\textunderscore}labels, rev})\index{LocalActionDiagramFromData@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramFromData}!for IsDigraph, IsList, IsList, IsPerm}
\label{LocalActionDiagramFromData:for IsDigraph, IsList, IsList, IsPerm}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramFromDataNC({\mdseries\slshape D, vertex{\textunderscore}labels, edge{\textunderscore}labels, rev})\index{LocalActionDiagramFromDataNC@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramFromDataNC}!for IsDigraph, IsList, IsList, IsPerm}
\label{LocalActionDiagramFromDataNC:for IsDigraph, IsList, IsList, IsPerm}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A local action diagram. 



 Constructs a local action diagram, checking that the arguments given are a
valid local action diagram. The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape D}} is a digraph and \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape rev}} must be a compatible involution on the edges of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape D}}. The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape vertex{\textunderscore}labels}} is a list of vertex labels such that \texttt{\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape vertex{\textunderscore}labels}}[i]} is the group labelling vertex \texttt{i} of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape D}}. 

 The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape edge{\textunderscore}labels}} is a list of edge labels. The edges of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape D}} are stored in lexicographical order and \texttt{\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape edge{\textunderscore}labels}}[i]} is the set labelling edge \texttt{i} of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape D}} (when sorted in lexicographical order). 

 The NC variant of the operation does not check that the arguments given are a
valid local action diagram. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramUniversalGroup (for IsPermGroup)}}
\logpage{[ 2, 1, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7ACD48EE7C32A9CC}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramUniversalGroup({\mdseries\slshape F})\index{LocalActionDiagramUniversalGroup@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramUniversalGroup}!for IsPermGroup}
\label{LocalActionDiagramUniversalGroup:for IsPermGroup}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A local action diagram. 



 Constructs a local action diagram corresponding to the
Burger\texttt{\symbol{45}}Mozes group $U(\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape F}})$ where \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape F}} is a permutation group. This diagram has a single vertex labelled by the group \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape F}} and a self\texttt{\symbol{45}}reverse loop for each orbit of the action of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape F}}. The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape F}} can instead by an object of the category \texttt{IsLocalAction} from the package \textsf{UGALY}. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramToUniversalGroup (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 2, 1, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X791D12FA87CE3D99}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramToUniversalGroup({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramToUniversalGroup@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramToUniversalGroup}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramToUniversalGroup:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A local action. 



 Given a local action diagram \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} corresponding to a Burger\texttt{\symbol{45}}Mozes group this returns the
corresponding group as an object of the category \texttt{IsLocalAction} from the package \textsf{UGALY}. The local action diagram \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} must have a single vertex and have only self\texttt{\symbol{45}}reverse edges.
It must also have at least one edge. }

 }

 }

   
\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Local Action Diagram Attributes and Operations}}\label{Chapter_Local_Action_Diagram_Attributes_and_Operations}

{
  

 
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Local Action Diagram Attributes}}\label{Chapter_Local_Action_Diagram_Attributes_and_Operations_Section_Local_Action_Diagram_Attributes}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X843901697917FCE2}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramVertexLabels (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X82F7822E7CE957E9}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramVertexLabels({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramVertexLabels@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramVertexLabels}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramVertexLabels:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A list of groups. 



 Returns the groups labelling the vertices of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. Entry \texttt{i} of the list corresponds to the group labelling vertex \texttt{i} of the digraph. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramEdges (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7EFA9F8A7AF03169}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdges({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramEdges@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdges}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramEdges:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A list of lists. 



 Returns a list of edges of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. Each edge is stored as a list \texttt{[i, j]} where \texttt{i} is the origin vertex and \texttt{j} is the terminus vertex. The list is stored in lexicographical order. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramEdgeLabels (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7DBFDBD67BEFFEDC}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdgeLabels({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramEdgeLabels@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdgeLabels}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramEdgeLabels:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A list of lists. 



 Returns the edge labels of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. Entry \texttt{i} of the list corresponds to the label of edge \texttt{i} of the digraph. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramEdgeReversal (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 1, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7AB4506A7B80460D}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdgeReversal({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramEdgeReversal@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdgeReversal}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramEdgeReversal:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A permutation. 



 Returns the reversal mapping of the local action digram \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. }

 }

 
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Local Action Diagram Operations}}\label{Chapter_Local_Action_Diagram_Attributes_and_Operations_Section_Local_Action_Diagram_Operations}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X85A1FDBA7F237079}{}
{
  

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramScopos (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X823C18F980B022A7}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramScopos({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramScopos@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramScopos}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramScopos:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A list of lists. 



 Returns a list of all scopos of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. Each entry of the list is a list of edges in the scopo. This list will
always contain the empty scopo \texttt{[]}. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramGroupType (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 2 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7E4954157FBEEC4A}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramGroupType({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramGroupType@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramGroupType}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramGroupType:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A string. 



 Returns the group type the local action digram corresponds to. This is either
"Fixed Vertex", "Edge Inversion", "Lineal", "Focal", or "General". Note that
all "Horocyclic" local action diagrams have infinitely many vertices and so
can never be the type returned by this function. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramIsDiscrete (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 3 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7CC179F27B503D31}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramIsDiscrete({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramIsDiscrete@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramIsDiscrete}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramIsDiscrete:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
\texttt{true} or \texttt{false}. 



 Returns \texttt{true} if \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} corresponds to a discrete group and \texttt{false} otherwise. }

 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{LocalActionDiagramIsUniscalar (for IsLocalActionDiagram)}}
\logpage{[ 3, 2, 4 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X7D93C024847EDC1C}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{LocalActionDiagramIsUniscalar({\mdseries\slshape lad})\index{LocalActionDiagramIsUniscalar@\texttt{LocalActionDiagramIsUniscalar}!for IsLocalActionDiagram}
\label{LocalActionDiagramIsUniscalar:for IsLocalActionDiagram}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (attribute)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
\texttt{true} if the corresponding group is uniscalar and \texttt{false} otherwise. 



 If \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} is of type "Fixed Vertex", "Edge Inversion", or "Lineal" then it is always
uniscalar and so the function returns true. If it is of type "General" then it
is uniscalar if and only if all vertices in the unique minimal cotree of \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} are semi\texttt{\symbol{45}}regular with their action restricted to the
cotree. 

 Is it better to describe the maths here or just say returns true or false.
Maybe give a theorem citation in the paper? }

 }

 }

   
\chapter{\textcolor{Chapter }{Input/Output and Visualisation}}\label{Chapter_InputOutput_and_Visualisation}
\logpage{[ 4, 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7BD3226C787EC8FB}{}
{
  
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Reading and Writing Local Action Diagrams To Files}}\label{Chapter_InputOutput_and_Visualisation_Section_Reading_and_Writing_Local_Action_Diagrams_To_Files}
\logpage{[ 4, 1, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7B71459086EC944E}{}
{
  

 Local action diagrams made in GAP can be written to a file. They can also be
read from the file into GAP. The format of these files are as follows: 

 
\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=!@|,fontsize=\small,frame=single,label=Example]
  <Digraph String>
  <Vertex Labels>
  <Edge Labels>
  <Edge Reversal Map>
  <List of Other Attributes>
\end{Verbatim}
 

 Multiple local action diagrams can be stored in the same file. 
\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Writing Local Action Diagrams}}\label{Writing_Local_Action_Diagrams}
\logpage{[ 4, 1, 1 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7A766DBD83D79FB7}{}
{
\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{WriteLocalActionDiagram({\mdseries\slshape lad, filename[, directory]})\index{WriteLocalActionDiagram@\texttt{WriteLocalActionDiagram}!for IsLocalActionDiagram, IsString}
\label{WriteLocalActionDiagram:for IsLocalActionDiagram, IsString}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{WriteLocalActionDiagram({\mdseries\slshape lad{\textunderscore}list, filename[, directory]})\index{WriteLocalActionDiagram@\texttt{WriteLocalActionDiagram}!for IsList, IsString}
\label{WriteLocalActionDiagram:for IsList, IsString}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
\texttt{true} if writing to the file was successful and \texttt{false} otherwise. 



 

 Writes the local action diagram \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}} or every local action diagram in the list \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape last{\textunderscore}list}} to the file \texttt{\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape filename}}.lad}. The list \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad{\textunderscore}list}} must be a dense list of local action diagrams. 

 If the optional argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape directory}} is specified then the file is written to that directory. Otherwise the file is
written to the current directory of the GAP session
\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}} i.e. \texttt{DirectoryCurrent()}. The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape directory}} can either be in the category \texttt{IsDirectory} or \texttt{IsString}. 

 If the file \texttt{\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape filename}}.lad} does not exist in the directory then it is create; otherwise the file is
appended to. }

 
\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{Reading Local Action Diagrams}}\label{Reading_Local_Action_Diagrams}
\logpage{[ 4, 1, 2 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X7E489CF58169A8D4}{}
{
\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{ReadLocalActionDiagram({\mdseries\slshape filename[, directory]})\index{ReadLocalActionDiagram@\texttt{ReadLocalActionDiagram}!for IsString}
\label{ReadLocalActionDiagram:for IsString}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
A list of local action diagrams if reading the file was successful or raises
an error and returns \texttt{fail} otherwise. 



 

 Reads the file \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape filename}}. If the optional argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape directory}} is specified then the file is read from that directory. Otherwise the file is
read from the current directory of the GAP session
\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}} i.e. \texttt{DirectoryCurrent()}. The argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape directory}} can either be in the category \texttt{IsDirectory} or \texttt{IsString}. 

 It is expected that the file was written with the \texttt{WriteLocalActionDiagram} function. Some basic error checking of the file is implemented as it is read
but this will not catch all errors in the file. }

 }

 
\section{\textcolor{Chapter }{Visualising Local Action Diagrams and $\Delta$\texttt{\symbol{45}}trees.}}\label{Chapter_InputOutput_and_Visualisation_Section_Visualising_Local_Action_Diagrams_and_MDeltaM-trees}
\logpage{[ 4, 2, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X85E80D0678A5F364}{}
{
  Functions are provided to visualise local action diagrams and $\Delta$\texttt{\symbol{45}}trees. Insert some more text here? 

\subsection{\textcolor{Chapter }{GenerateTikZCode (for IsLocalActionDiagram, IsString)}}
\logpage{[ 4, 2, 1 ]}\nobreak
\hyperdef{L}{X841F1D0A7C4F247A}{}
{\noindent\textcolor{FuncColor}{$\triangleright$\enspace\texttt{GenerateTikZCode({\mdseries\slshape lad, filename[, highlight{\textunderscore}edges, directory]})\index{GenerateTikZCode@\texttt{GenerateTikZCode}!for IsLocalActionDiagram, IsString}
\label{GenerateTikZCode:for IsLocalActionDiagram, IsString}
}\hfill{\scriptsize (operation)}}\\
\textbf{\indent Returns:\ }
\texttt{true} if the code was generated successfully and \texttt{fail} otherwise. 



 Generates TikZ code that draws the local action diagram \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. Currently this function only supports local action diagrams with one or two
vertices. The TikZ code is written to \texttt{\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape filename}}.tex}. This file must be compiled separately. 

 The optional argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape highlight{\textunderscore}edges}} must be a list of edges
\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}} i.e. a subset of \texttt{LocalActionDiagramEdges(\mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}})}. If given, the edges specified in this list are highlighted. This could, for
example, highlight a particular scopo in \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape lad}}. 

 By default the output file is written in the current working directory
\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}}\texttt{\symbol{45}} i.e. \texttt{DirectoryCurrent()}. The optional argument \mbox{\texttt{\mdseries\slshape directory}} can either be a string or directory object. If it is given then then the file
will be output to the specified directory. }

 }

 }

 \def\indexname{Index\logpage{[ "Ind", 0, 0 ]}
\hyperdef{L}{X83A0356F839C696F}{}
}
